name: Kentucky Long-Term Care Ombudsman
description: The Kentucky Long-Term Care Ombudsman program advocates for residents of nursing homes, personal care homes, and family care homes in all 120 counties of Kentucky. The program is operated by the Cabinet for Health and Family Services and provides free, confidential advocacy services to help resolve problems and protect the rights of long-term care facility residents. The ombudsman investigates complaints, provides information about long-term care facilities, and works to improve the quality of care and life for residents.
source: Verified from multiple official sources including Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services, National Ombudsman Resource Center, and various state resource guides
notes: State Long-Term Care Ombudsman: Sherry Culp. TTY access available at 800-627-4702. The program serves all 120 counties in Kentucky and provides free, confidential advocacy services for long-term care facility residents and their families.
